members.name: source
members.comment: The source object needing translating.

members.name: getTranslatorClass
members.comment: Find a translator for this class. If one doesn't exist for this class explicitly, try its superclass and so on.

param: c - a Class
return: the Translator Class for the Class passed in

members.name: getAccessible
members.comment: Obtain an object that implements interface Accessible. If the object passed in already implements interface Accessible, getAccessible merely returns the object.

param: o - an Object; if a null is passed in a null is returned
return: an Object, possibly the Object passed in, that implements the Accessible interface for the Object which was passed in

members.name: getSource
members.comment: Get the source Object of the Translator.

return: the source Object of the Translator

members.name: setSource
members.comment: Set the source object of the Translator.

param: o - the Component that does not implement interface Accessible

members.name: equals
members.comment: Returns true if this object is the same as the one passed in.

param: o - the Object to check against
return: true if this is the same object

members.name: hashCode
members.comment: Return hashcode.

return: hashcode

members.name: getAccessibleContext
members.comment: Returns this object.

return: the AccessibleContext associated with this object

members.name: getAccessibleName
members.comment: Get the accessible name of this object.

return: the localized name of the object; can be null if this object does not have a name

members.name: setAccessibleName
members.comment: Set the name of this object.

param: s - the new localized name of the object

members.name: getAccessibleDescription
members.comment: Get the accessible description of this object.

return: the description of the object; can be null if this object does not have a description

members.name: setAccessibleDescription
members.comment: Set the accessible description of this object.

param: s - the new localized description of the object

members.name: getAccessibleRole
members.comment: Get the role of this object.

return: an instance of AccessibleRole describing the role of the object

members.name: getAccessibleStateSet
members.comment: Get the state of this object, given an already populated state. This method is intended for use by subclasses so they don't have to check for everything.

return: an instance of AccessibleStateSet containing the current state of the object

members.name: getAccessibleParent
members.comment: Get the accessible parent of this object.

return: the accessible parent of this object; can be null if this object does not have an accessible parent

members.name: getAccessibleIndexInParent
members.comment: Get the index of this object in its accessible parent.

return: -1 of this object does not have an accessible parent; otherwise, the index of the child in its accessible parent

members.name: getAccessibleChildrenCount
members.comment: Returns the number of accessible children in the object.

return: the number of accessible children in the object

members.name: getAccessibleChild
members.comment: Return the nth accessible child of the object.

param: i - zero-based index of child
return: the nth accessible child of the object

members.name: getLocale
members.comment: Gets the Locale of the component. If the component does not have a locale, the locale of its parent is returned.

throws: IllegalComponentStateException - If the component does not have its own locale and has not yet been added to a containment hierarchy such that the locale can be determined from the containing parent
return: the Locale of the object

members.name: addPropertyChangeListener
members.comment: Add a PropertyChangeListener to the listener list. The listener is registered for all properties.

param: l - The PropertyChangeListener to be added

members.name: removePropertyChangeListener
members.comment: Remove the PropertyChangeListener from the listener list.

param: l - The PropertyChangeListener to be removed

members.name: getBackground
members.comment: Get the background Color of this object.

return: if supported, the background Color of the object; otherwise, null

members.name: setBackground
members.comment: Set the background Color of this object.

param: c - the new Color for the background

members.name: getForeground
members.comment: Get the foreground Color of this object.

return: if supported, the foreground Color of the object; otherwise, null

members.name: setForeground
members.comment: Set the foreground Color of this object.

param: c - the new Color for the foreground

members.name: getCursor
members.comment: Get the Cursor of this object.

return: if supported, the Cursor of the object; otherwise, null

members.name: setCursor
members.comment: Set the Cursor of this object.

param: c - the new Cursor for the object

members.name: getFont
members.comment: Get the Font of this object.

return: if supported, the Font for the object; otherwise, null

members.name: setFont
members.comment: Set the Font of this object.

param: f - the new Font for the object

members.name: getFontMetrics
members.comment: Get the FontMetrics of this object.

param: f - the Font
return: if supported, the FontMetrics the object; otherwise, null

members.name: isEnabled
members.comment: Determine if the object is enabled.

return: true if object is enabled; otherwise, false

members.name: setEnabled
members.comment: Set the enabled state of the object.

param: b - if true, enables this object; otherwise, disables it

members.name: isVisible
members.comment: Determine if the object is visible.

return: true if object is visible; otherwise, false

members.name: setVisible
members.comment: Set the visible state of the object.

param: b - if true, shows this object; otherwise, hides it

members.name: isShowing
members.comment: Determine if the object is showing. This is determined by checking the visibility of the object and ancestors of the object.

return: true if object is showing; otherwise, false

members.name: contains
members.comment: Checks whether the specified Point is within this object's bounds, where the Point is relative to the coordinate system of the object.

param: p - the Point relative to the coordinate system of the object
return: true if object contains Point; otherwise false

members.name: getLocationOnScreen
members.comment: Returns the location of the object on the screen.

return: location of object on screen; can be null if this object is not on the screen

members.name: getLocation
members.comment: Returns the location of the object relative to parent.

return: location of object relative to parent; can be null if this object or its parent are not on the screen

members.name: setLocation
members.comment: Sets the location of the object relative to parent.

param: p - the new position for the top-left corner

members.name: getBounds
members.comment: Returns the current bounds of this object.

return: current bounds of object; can be null if this object is not on the screen

members.name: setBounds
members.comment: Sets the current bounds of this object.

param: r - rectangle indicating this component's bounds

members.name: getSize
members.comment: Returns the current size of this object.

return: current size of object; can be null if this object is not on the screen

members.name: setSize
members.comment: Sets the current size of this object.

param: d - The dimension specifying the new size of the object

members.name: getAccessibleAt
members.comment: Returns the accessible child contained at the local coordinate Point, if one exists.

param: p - The point relative to the coordinate system of this object
return: the Accessible at the specified location, if it exists

members.name: isFocusTraversable
members.comment: Returns whether this object can accept focus or not.

return: true if object can accept focus; otherwise false

members.name: requestFocus
members.comment: Requests focus for this object.

members.name: addFocusListener
members.comment: Adds the specified FocusListener to receive focus events from this component.

param: l - the focus listener

members.name: removeFocusListener
members.comment: Removes the specified focus listener so it no longer receives focus events from this component.

param: l - the focus listener; this method performs no function, nor does it throw an exception if the listener specified was not previously added to this component; if listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.

members.comment: Create a new Translator. You must call the setSource method to set the object to be translated after calling this constructor.
Create a new Translator with the source object o.

param: o - the Component that does not implement interface Accessible

name: com.sun.java.accessibility.util.Translator
comment:
The Translator class provides a translation to interface Accessible for objects that do not implement interface Accessible. Assistive technologies can use the getAccessible class method of Translator to obtain an object that implements interface Accessible. If the object passed in already implements interface Accessible, getAccessible merely returns the object.

An example of how an assistive technology might use the Translator class is as follows: 

    Accessible accessible = Translator.getAccessible(someObj);
    // obtain information from the 'accessible' object.

Note: This implementation is missing many things and is not a recommended way to implement accessibility features for a toolkit. Instead of relying upon this code, a toolkit's components should implement interface Accessible directly.
